user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskPrepare:
```c
static int32 OS_TaskPrepare(osal_id_t task_id, osal_task_entry *entrypt)
{
    int32                      return_code;
    OS_object_token_t          token;
    OS_task_internal_record_t *task;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK, task_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        task = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_task_table, token);

        return_code = OS_TaskMatch_Impl(&token);
        *entrypt    = task->entry_function_pointer;

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_TaskRegister_Impl(task_id);
    }

    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        /* Give event callback to the application */
        return_code = OS_NotifyEvent(OS_EVENT_TASK_STARTUP, task_id, NULL);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *entrypt = NULL;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
*entrypt    = task->entry_function_pointer;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No. The assignment writes to the output parameter *entrypt (copying the task's function pointer into the caller-supplied storage), so the pointed-to type cannot be const in this use. Also the code is copying a function pointer value (not modifying the target function), and function types cannot be meaningfully const-qualified. Therefore Rule 8.13 is not violated. (A violation would occur if the pointer were only read and never modified but declared without const.)
